newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian dollar deposits quietly steady in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Asian dollar deposits quietly steady in late trade.

text.p: Asian dollar deposit rates were quietly steady in lacklustre trade with most traders sidelined due mainly to an absence of fresh incentives, dealers said on Monday.

"Rates were mostly steady in the morning on some position adjustments. Most people were hesitant to open or hold new positions because there's no fresh news on (U.S. economic) indicators coming out tonight," a local dealer said.
"But some people are waiting for Tuesday's (U.S. April) retail sales index and Wednesday's (U.S. April) producer price index data, for more clues to market direction," he added.
In day-to-day rates, Monday/Tuesday and Tuesday/Wednesday were unchanged from last Friday's common 5-9/16 5-7/16 percent, respectively.
Among longer dates, one-month was unchanged at 5-11/16 5-9/16 percent, three-months unchanged at 5-13/16 5-11/16 and nine-months unchanged at 6-1/8 6 percent.
Twelve-months eased 1/16 percentage point to 6-1/4 6-1/8 percent.
